passage.title: Good Morning
passage.text: The alarm goes off. The time is 7:00am. Your class starts at 8:30am. Your drive will take you 30 minutes. Do you wish to:
passage.option: Step onto the street and wait for an opening

passage.title: WAKE UP AND GET READY
passage.text: You hav to start the day eventually.

passage.title: SNOOZE FOR JUST 10 MORE MINUTES
passage.text: Oh no! The time is 7:40! You overslept! You rush to pack your things in hopes you can still make it. All is going well until you trip over a pebble. You fell straight into your dogâ€™s poop. You accept defeat and go back inside.

passage.title: Get Ready for College
passage.text: You get dressed and pack your lunch, you are ready to head to school. Just going to be another boring day of college.

passage.title: Get Ready for College
passage.text: Your still a little tired and don't really feel like driving. You're thinking about what should you do.
passage.option: Drive to school(You need to suck it up and just drive to school)
Call an Uber(It shouldn't take that long for someone to pick you up, and you can nap on the way.)
Walk to school(It's better to excersise on days like these to wake up quickly.)

passage.title: At the Street
passage.text: You are standing at the edge of a busy street. Cars are speeding by, and you need to get to the other side. What do you do?
passage.option: Step onto the street and wait for an opening

passage.title: In the Middle of the Street
passage.text: You step onto the street and wait for an opening in traffic. Cars are zooming by, and you feel the rush of wind as each one passes dangerously close. Do you keep waiting or move?
passage.option: Keep waiting in the middle of the street

passage.title: Turning Back
passage.text: You decide that crossing the street isn't worth the risk. You turn around and head back where you came from. You feel safe, but the task remains unfinished.
passage.option: Return to the edge of the street

passage.title: Safely Across
passage.text: With a burst of courage, you sprint across the street, dodging cars with precision. You make it to the other side safely, your heart pounding from the adrenaline. You've successfully crossed the street!

passage.title: Tragic End
passage.text: You decide to keep waiting in the middle of the street, hoping for a safe moment to cross. But as you hesitate, a car appears suddenly and can't stop in time... This is the end.
